Among her possibilities is selling chicken dishes on the weekend.  She considers this a job that requires less effort; also, she's a friendly person who's well known in her area.

She hopes to continue generating income to pay the expenses for one of her younger children's advanced studies.  She'll request 500 soles [PEN] to buy utensils and supplies to get started in her business selling chicken dishes in her community.

loans.use: to buy chickens, condiments, and disposable plates

loans.name: Adelia

texts.es: La señora Adelia sigue con su misma actividad que es la venta de varios productos de primera necesidad  en una tienda de barrio que tiene hace ya mucho tiempo,  cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior credito que lo utilizo en la compra de material de construcción para remodelar (acabado de obra fina) su departamento en la casa de sus suegros, ahora solicita el credito para la compra de abarrotes como arroz, fideo, y tambien para la compra de variedad de productos como dulces y refrescos y panetones para esta epoca de fin de año ya que se incrementa su venta y es donde genera mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Adelia continues with her same job selling various staple items in a neighborhood store she has had for a long time.  She says the previous loan went well for her.  She used it to buy construction materials to remodel, putting the finishing touches on her apartment in her in-laws' house.

Now she's requesting a loan to buy groceries such as rice and noodles, and also to buy a variety of products such as candy, soda, and panettone because her sales increase in this end-of-the-year season and she generates more income.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 47 años, es una mujer  muy alegre y soñadora. Vive en su casa propia junto a su conviviente segundo quien se dedica a servicios múltiples,como ser obrero en construcción y taxista, etc. crían a sus 3 hijos de 15, 6 y 3 años quienes están estudiando. El trabajo de Martha  consiste en la venta de comida como pollo frito, hamburguesas, arroz chaufa,  guiso de pollo, etc. realiza esta actividad en el frontis de su casa propia. Cada día al atardecer saca sus utensilios como mesas, sillas, platos, cucharas, etc. Se inicio en esta actividad por la necesidad de apoyar a sus hijos en su educación y también tener un empleo  con el cual pueda ayudar en los gastos de su hogar. Junto a su conviviente realizan las compras cada día muy temprano, su hijo mayor la ayuda en la preparación de las distintas viandas. Considera rentable su negocio porque tiene buena sazón, sus clientes cada día se incrementan y sus ganancias hacienden  a un  50% de lo invertido. Antes de empezar su actividad  tenía problemas económicos, por no tener un empleo  estable. Por eso decidió  poner su negocio propio.  En el futuro espera poder construir un local en el interior de su vivienda, poner un restauran y generar mas ganancias económicas. Por tanto solicita 1,000 mil soles, lo utilizará para la compra de los ingredientes como arroz, huevos, condimentos, panes, papa,  etc. para preparar los distintos platos de comida. Se encuentra muy feliz  por contar con un respaldo económico para su negocio.
texts.en: Martha is 47 years old, a happy woman and a dreamer.  She lives in her own home together with her second husband, who makes his living in multiple areas.  He is a construction worker and a taxi driver, etc.  They are raising their three children, who are 15, 6 and 3 years old.  All three go to school.  Martha's work is preparing and selling food, like fried chicken, hamburgers, fried rice, chicken stew etc.  She runs her business in front of her house.  Each day, at dusk, she takes out her utensils, like tables, chairs, plates, spoons, etc.  She started her business because she needed a way to support her children's education and also to have a job to help with the household expenses.  Martha and her husband do the shopping together very early every morning.  Her oldest son helps her to prepare the different food.  She thinks that her business is profitable because of the good flavor of her dishes.  She has more customers every day and her earnings reach 50% of what she invests.  Prior to starting her business, Martha had financial problems because she didn't have a steady job, which is why she decided to start her own business.  In the future, she hopes to build a restaurant in her home, to make a better living.  She is requesting a loan of 1,000 mil soles (USD $400), which she will use to purchase ingredients like rice, eggs, condiments, bread, potatoes, etc. to prepare different plates of food.  Martha is very happy to have financial backing for her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, eggs, condiments, bread and potatoes.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a 47-year-old farmer from Nkubu county in Kenya where he lives with his wife. He has been practicing mixed farming for over 20 years, producing tea, peas, milk, beans and maize, which he sells at the local market in his local area.

He is requesting a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. The proceeds from the products he will sell will be used to improve his poultry business and his livelihood. He aspires to buy another one-acre piece of land in the next five years.

The high cost of feed and the poor market for his products are his main challenges in farming.

Silas is happy with the way Juhudi Kilimo is processing loans.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Emardin

texts.en:
Emardin is a very responsible, hardworking person who would like to improve her quality of life and that of her family in order to triumph in life. She is 46 years old, is widowed, and lives with her six children in the rural area of Samburu, Kinango district.

Emardin works along with her children in agriculture. They grow a variety of crops like sugarcane, bananas, and vegetables, and also keep livestock.  They also need to invest in the purchase of seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers.

She dreams of having a ready market for her produce and of improving the quality of life of her children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Faïda Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe FAÏDA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à NOUMOUSSO un des quartiers populaires de la ville de KADIOLO (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
MARIAM assise  1ère  à droite sur la photo fait la vente de pagnes wax et real dans ce groupe de femmes FAÏDA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt six pièces de pagnes wax et réal. Elle s’approvisionne en Côte d’Ivoire auprès des grossistes et souvent au grand marché de la ville, les jours de foire.
Elle  vend au marché  et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant  en détail. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.750 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the group FAÏDA are married women averaging 37 years of age and three children each. The women live in polygamous families in NOUMOUSSO, a working-class district in Kadiolo City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are on their third loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers. The past loans were correctly paid back.
 
MARIAM, who is sitting first from the right in the photo, sells Wax and Real 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa). She gets her supplies from Cote d'Ivoire from wholesalers and often from the big market in town on market days. She sells them retail for cash to a customer base composed of men and women at the market and at home.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 32,750 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used for repaying the loan and the interest on it, and the other part is for her savings.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa)

loans.name: Sindiya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe SINDIYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles polygamies à NOUMOUSSO un des quartiers populaires de la ville de KADIOLO. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
DJENEBA assise  1ère  à gauche sur la photo fait la vente de condiments  et des pagnes wax et real dans ce groupe de femmes SINDIYA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, cinq emballages de condiments. Elle s’approvisionne souvent dans les villages avoisinants Kadiolo ville  et chez les grossistes au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso les jours de foire.
Elle les revend au marché  de Kadiolo ville et en famille à une clientèle mixte au comptant, à crédit et en détail. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.750FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the group SINDIYA are married women averaging 37 years of age and three children each. The women live in polygamous families in NOUMOUSSO, a working-class district in Kadiolo City. They are on their third loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers. The past loans were correctly paid back.
 
DJENEBA, who is sitting first from the left in the photo, buys and sells condiments, as well as Wax and Real 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) in this group of women. She intends to use her loan to purchase 5 packs of condiments. She gets her supplies from the villages neighboring Kadiolo City and from wholesalers at the big market of Sikasso City on market days. Accepting cash and credit, she sells them retail to a mixed customer base at the Kadiolo City market and at home.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,750 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used for repaying the loan and the interest on it, and the other part is for her savings.

loans.use: to purchase condiments to sell

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 36 years old and lives with her seven children and husband. She sells dried fish in the town market. She has had this business for many years and has a lot of sales experience. She has acquired a lot of customers because she always has what people are looking for and she offers the best quality products at low prices. 

Sophia is a hard-working woman who strives to get ahead. She wants to succeed in the short-term, which gives her a lot of motivation and strength in her work. She is asking for a loan to buy more sacks of dried fish to sell. She is a responsible person with a spotless moral character, and she is sure that she will be able to successfully repay the loan. She hopes to provide economic security for her household.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: ro purchase irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Elgiz

texts.en:
Elgiz is 28 years old. He is a single person. Egiz lives in the Fizuli region with his family, but he was an IDP (internally displaced person) person from Fizuli city. 

Now he needs 1,000 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy new wheels and other spare parts for his car. He loves his work. Elgiz has been in this taxi business for 2 years. He wants to increase his monthly income to help his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
This young woman is starting a business of selling clothing (khangas). She wants to have a new start and to be more responsible, which is one of the best and biggest decisions that she has made. Her family is ready to give her support. She currently sells fried fish, a business she has run for the last three years. 

Mlongo is an active woman. She is enterprising, dedicated to her work, and a fighter with many goals that she wants to achieve. She is working hard to reach a more prosperous future and is very happy with the business. 

Mlongo anticipates a good return on this investment because she wants to take advantage of the approaching December festive season. She plans to sell door-to-door in the neighborhood. However, she does not plan to quit her fish selling business since she mostly sells during the afternoon hours. 

With the loan, Mlongo will buy bales of khangas to sell.

loans.use: to buy bales of khangas to sell.

loans.name: Valya

texts.en:
Valya lives in Gyumri town with her family. She is a teacher and works at local school. Her daughter, Sona, studies at the Armenian State Economic University in the faculty of Public Finance.

It is very difficult for Valya to sustain the family of five. Valya's salary allows her to cover family's basic costs, but is not enough to save for Sona's education. 

With the requested amount, Valya will pay for her daughter’s annual tuition fee and will be able to ensure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's annual tuition fee.

loans.name: Al-Khir Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Khir. It consists of 6 ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. 

Eyman is 23 years old. She is a single woman who lives in Taiz, Yemen. She owns a house and she applied for a youth loan of 30000 YER from AMB to buy water tank for her house.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for her house.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre agricultor de 40 años de edad, el esta soltero y vive en Sololá. 
El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando papa, cebolla, zanahoria y ejote, en unas parcelas que presta con otras personas a pocos kilómetros de su vivienda, esto lo aprendió de su padre pero antes de realizar su propio cultivo el trabajo con personas ajenas donde perfecciono y obtuvo mas experiencia en este trabajo.
El ahora cuenta con 15 años de realizar su propio cultivo viendo que tendría  mejores ganancias, de este modo el solicita un préstamo de   Q 4,000.00 para que pueda comprar semillas  de papa y su fertilizante para luego cultivarlo y cosecharlo mejorando sus ingresos y condiciones de vida de su familia.
Con sus ganancias el sueña la compra de una parcela y expandir su cultivo,  también construir una mejor  vivienda para su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a farmer.  He is 40 years old, single and lives in Sololá. 
Juan makes his living growing potatoes, onions, carrots and green beans on a plot of land that he rents with other farmers.  It is located a few kilometers from his home.  Juan learned to farm from his father, but before growing his own crop, he worked with others.  That helped him to perfect his work and to gain more experience farming. 
Juan has now been growing his own crops for fifteen years.  He saw that he would have a getter income working on his own.  He is requesting a loan of Q 4,000.00 (USD $525) so that he can purchase potato seed and fertilizer to later plant and harvest.  This will improve his income and his family's quality of life. 
With his earnings, Juan dreams of purchasing a plot of land and expanding his plantings.  He also wants to build a better dwelling for his family.

loans.use: to purchase potato seed and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.es:
Marciana es madre y abuela, mujer muy trabajadora, a pesar de sus 52 años se siente llena de vida y a la vez orgullosa de ver hoy a sus hijos ya mayores e independientes forjándose un buen porvenir, posee una vivienda de material noble que logró construir de a pocos. Dejando de lado las actividades agropecuarias que desempeñó hasta hace un tiempo busco una alternativa de negocio como es la venta de pescado y verduras al por mayor. Viene desempeñándose como tal desde hace 1 año en la cual le han servido para conocer a sus nuevos clientes  quienes ahora son sus amigos. Se desplaza sola con ayuda de transportistas que recorren dichas rutas llevando sus productos para su expendio preferentemente los fines de semana.
Le agrada mucho su actividad puesto que debe madrugar muchas veces y recorrer diversos puntos de su localidad llegando a contactarse con muchas personas quienes valoran mucho su trabajo y llegan a entablar una buena amistad con ella no obstante es necesario aclarar que termina el día muy agotada después de retornar a su domicilio en donde almacena sus productos.
Al cumplir exactamente un año en su labor tiene planeado expandir la compra de su mercadería para abastecer a mas anexos para el cual desea mayor capital logrando así concretar uno de sus objetivos que es el de llegar a todos los puntos de su localidad. Este viene a ser su primer crédito con MFP, se siente muy contenta por la oportunidad brindada así como comprometida con el pago responsable de sus cuotas. Espera mantener la armonía y motivación que halló desde el momento en que ingreso a su grupo comunal ya que lo considera una gran equipo.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles complementará su capital destinado para la compra de mercadería consistente en pescado congelado y verduras de primera necesidad muy solicitados por sus clientes minoristas.
texts.en:
Marciana is a mother and a grandmother; she’s a very hardworking woman.  Despite her age of 52, she is full of life and proud to see her children now productive, independent adults who are forging good futures.  She owns a house built of substantial materials that she managed to build little by little.  Up until a short time ago, she worked in agriculture and animal husbandry but then looked for a business alternative like the sale of fish and vegetables at wholesale.  She’s been doing this for a year and she’s met new customers who are now her friends.  She heads out by herself with help from transportation providers who cover her routes taking her products preferably on the weekend.

She likes her activity very much because she must rise at dawn often and cover several points in her location contacting many people who value her work very much and establish good friendships with her; it must be clear, however, that she ends her day exhausted after returning home where she stores her goods.

At the exact first year anniversary of her business, she plans to buy merchandise to supply more annexes and needs more capital to do so since one of her goals it to reach all the points in her location.  This will be her first MFP loan and she feels very happy with the opportunity being provided and is committed make her payments responsibly.  She hopes to retain the harmony and motivation she found since first becoming part of her communal bank; she considers it to be a great team.  She will use the 1,000 new soles to add to her capital earmarked to buy merchandise consisting of frozen fish and basic staple vegetables that are in high demand by her retailer customers.

loans.use: to buy frozen fish and vegetables.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 24-year-old, Lebanese man. He got engaged few years ago, waiting the perfect time to get married and have his own family. Meanwhile, he’s living with his parents and four siblings. His father is their main income provider. Ahmad is really ambitious, he seeks to grow very fast in his domain and better support his family. He opened his own pharmacy in 2009 and has his own, loyal customers. 

Today, he needs to borrow a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the required quantity of medicines and renovate his pharmacy as well. He notes that this will allow him to respond to his clients rapidly. He plans to enlarge his pharmacy and open other braches, in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase the required quantity of medicines and renovate his pharmacy as well

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is a 35-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and four children. Two of her children are still attending school. In 2009, in order to supplement the family’s income, she decided to start her own home business. She’s a bread baker. She prepares bread and delivers it to her neighbors in town and the surrounding areas. Her husband, who works on his own, represents the main income source of the family. 

Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase ingredients for the bread and better improve her business. She states that the loan will certainly help her increase her business productivity by a large percentage, which will earn her higher profits. In the future, she plans to diversify her products and, therefore, attract additional clients.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 59-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children who are attending school. He has been working for a local company since 2008. He is the only source of income for his family. His wife is taking care of the house and the children as well. But Hussein’s income is not covering all their needs, especially his children’s educational fees. This is the reason he’s requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. In this way, he will be able to pay his children's school fees. His only goal is to insure a good education for his children until graduation and avoid facing financial problems for the family. One of his greatest dreams is to see his children achieve good positions.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 34 years old and a farmer in Nkubu county in Kenya where he lives with his child who is in school. He has been in farming for over 10 years producing tea and milk, which he sells to the people in his local area.

He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase materials to construct a greenhouse, which will help him get more produce and hence more income to boost his livelihood and pay for his child's education.

Unpredictable weather conditions and lack of a readily available market are his major challenges in farming.

George is grateful for the sincerity of Juhudi Kilimo's staff.

loans.use: To purchase materials do construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is 53 years old and very much wants to get ahead and improve her life. She lives with her family in her house, the same place where she has her business. She has a shop selling essentials like bread, drinks, frozen and canned products, dairy products, sweets, and more.

Until her sales have become stable, which she wants to considerably improve, Mbeyu is asking for a loan from Yehu, with which she can have the necessary money to be able to buy bigger quantities of foodstuffs, detergents, basic grains, paraffin, and other instant products.  This will benefit her shop by making it stronger so that people prefer her shop and it is the first choice for buying what they need for their home.

loans.use: to buy bigger quantities of foodstuffs, detergents, basic grains, paraffin, and other instant products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience learned how to sew at a young age and has dedicated most of her life to this activity. This has enabled her to acquire a great deal of experience, which has resulted in a reputation for offering products that are of the highest quality and above all, unequaled services. With a sewing workshop at the town center, Patience is able to generate income, contribute financially to her household, and provide her family with a better quality of life. She does repairs and sewing of new clothing at the same time.

She received a few orders some time ago, but has not been able to fulfill them due to a lack of capital to buy the materials that she needs. For this reason, she seeks to overcome this difficulty by requesting a loan in order to buy raw materials and sewing supplies that will allow her to complete her customers’ orders. Patience dreams of continuing to develop her business and gradually improving her business revenues. This will enable her to improve the facilities in her home and to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and sewing supplies

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия очень успешная женщина в своем селе.  Ее все уважают и знают как добросовестную и целеустремленную женщину. Ей 41 года. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Личная жизнь у нее не удачная, так как ее муж бросил ее с 3 детьми и даже не обеспечивает их нужными для проживания средствами. Зулфия очень трудно справляется с обеспечением детей. Хотя родители ей помогают, однако на помощь ей не прожить. С целью улучшения условия жизни Зулфия решила организовать свой бизнес для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес выращиванием сельхоз культуры, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки минеральных удобрений и семена, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zulfiya is a very successful woman in her village. She is respected and known as a fair and purposeful woman. She is 41 years old. She is divorced and is raising three children. In her personal life she is not lucky, as her husband left her with three children, and does not even provide them with the necessary resources for living. It is difficult for Zulfiya to provide for the children. However her parents help her, even if she does not want help. 

In order to improve their living conditions, Zulfiya decided to set up her own business for the good of the family. With this aim she attended the course "Bring It On", organized by the Association of Business Women and she received a certificate. Now she may organize her business and become successful in this area. 

Zulfiya would like to set up a business of growing agricultural crops, as she has experience in this type of business. From the income received she plans to provide her children with a good education and proper food. She requests a loan in the amount of 1,500 somoni for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and seeds, in order to set up the new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers for setting up a new business

loans.name: Surayyo

texts.ru: Сурайё жительница Гиссарского района. Ей 36 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Сурайё у себя дома занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Она портниха. Этим видом деятельности Сурайё занимается 7 лет. Она берет кредит для ремонта дома и приобретения новой швейной машинки, чтобы предоставлять качественную услугу.
texts.en:
Surayyo is a resident of the Gissar region. She is 36 years old and married. She has two children. Surayyo works from home, sewing national dresses. She is a seamstress. She has been working with this type of activity for 7 years. 

Surayyo takes a loan to repair the house and to purchase a new sewing machine, in order to provide quality services.

loans.use: to repair her house and purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Mahfurat

texts.ru: Трудное условие жизни заставляет человека направлять все свои усилия и мотивировать существующие ресурсы. Махфурат является одним из таких личностей, которая старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Она вдова и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Так как ее муж умер, она осталась без кормился, и она должна справляться с расходами сама. Махфурат решила организовать свой бизнес для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей продуктовых товаров. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Difficult living conditions force a person to focus all their efforts and make use of all existing resources. Mahfurat is one of these individuals who try to improve living conditions and boost the economic condition of the family. She is a widow and is raising a child. When her husband died, she was left with no food and she had to cope with the costs herself. 

Mahfurat decided to set up her own business for the good of the family. With this aim she attended the course "Bring It On", organized by the Association of Business Women, and she received a certificate. Currently she can set up her own business and become successful in this area. She would like to set up a business of buying and selling food products. From the income received, she plans to improve her living conditions. 

Mahfurat requests a loan in the amount of 2,000 somoni for the purchase of products, in order to set up the new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase food products for setting up a new business

loans.name: Lyudmila

texts.en:
Lyudmila lives in Gyumri town with her husband and 3 children. She works at local school as a teacher and her husband Artur is a taxi driver. Lyudmila’s elder daughter studies at Armenian-Russian Slavonic University in the department of Finance and Credit. 
Together with her husband, Lyudmila works hard to sustain her family’s living. Unfortunately this family’s current income doesn’t allow them to pay for their daughter’s tuition. So Lyudmila has applied for this loan of 230,000 AMD, to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en: Umasi is grateful for the support she got from the previous loan. She says that her business is doing well and that she can now count on good results from her previous investments. She has been able to improve her standard of living. Umasi wants to make some improvements to her house, which is why she is asking for a loan to buy iron sheets for roofing. She will also buy assorted nails, timbers, etc. She thanks Kiva lenders and Yehu for entrusting her with loans.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets, assorted nails, timbers, etc. to improve her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah is from the town of Samburu. She is married and has five grown children. She is the proprietor of a mini-store, where she sells drinks, flour, basic grains, and other household items. She began with a small business and later, little by little, grew to where she is today, thanks to her self-sacrifice.

Rodah comments that, thanks to this work, she can keep up her home and cover the expenses that arise in her home on a daily basis. She says that she would like to be able to continue with this business, as she has good sales, and the business generates a good income for her.

Rodah is requesting a loan for the purchase of drinks, flour, sugar, rice, and other things, with which she will be able to stock up her business. In this way, she will have everything in her store for any customer, whatever they need.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, flour, sugar, rice, and other things to sell in her mini-store.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en: Rabih is a 31-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married to Najla, a beautiful young woman. They have only two children, who are still studying. Rabih is a great man who loves his family and really cares to offer them a respectable life. He works non-stop, on his own, to be able to cover their expenses. He has been working as a plumber since 2000. He is also specialized in installing solar systems. He’s an honest man and above all punctual, which makes his customers loyal to him. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his plumbing tools. This Kiva loan will facilitate his business operations and allow him start his new project properly. This is how Rabih works to collect higher revenues and help his family live a very comfortable life away from struggle.

loans.use: to renew his plumbing tools and start a new project properly.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona is 26-year-old proactive student. She lives in Baghramyan village in the Ararat region with her family. Sona studies at the Armenian State University, in the faculty of Philosophy and Psychology. She is in her fourth course. 
Sona’s parents are involved in agriculture, which is the main source of income for her family. It is very difficult for the family to cover their daily costs and save money for Sona’s education. This is why Sona has applied for this loan to pay for tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Aziah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Aziah, and it consists of seven ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 210000 YER from AMB.
Aziah raises sheep. She has been in this line of work for many years. She is 23 years old and single and lives in Taiz, Yemen. She is asking for a youth loan of 30000 YER from AMB to buy sheep for resale. This loan enables her to sell the sheep as well to generate even more income. She hopes to provide a better life to her family. She promises to pay on time and is very grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.en:
Adrian is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in silver and gemstone jewelry.  He would like to invest in the purchase of gemstones and raw silver to continue production.  Adrian has been selling through NOVICA since 2010.  This is his story:

"In jewelry, I've found a medium of bodily expression.  In the School of Fine Arts, I learned to express my ideas with a brush and oils.  I can also do so through silver, gold and precious stones.  I live in Peru doing what I love most, and I am passionate about jewelry.  For me, each piece of jewelry is a work of art, and I'm a perfectionist as I create them.  I hope you enjoy the quality and design of my art."

"I wish to thank everyone involved in this microcredit, because with it I'll be able to increase my production.  I will also be able to work on new designs for all the wonderful women that enjoy wearing my jewelry."

Use the link below to view Adrian's silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7520

loans.use: to purchase gemstones and raw silver to continue production

loans.name: Aldarmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Aldarmaa is a 35-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children in Ger in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband Davaatseren has been working as an assistant worker in a wooden furniture manufacturing company for years. Her daughter Angarmaa, who is 14, and her son Purev-Ochir, who is 11, are secondary school students. She has been running a butcher shop since 2003 in a rental counter of a local market. She and her husband are planning to start a new business of furniture manufacturing in their area. She has already built a strong relationship with local suppliers and customers and it will be easier for them to start their new wooden furniture manufacturing business. She is now requesting 3,800,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory for starting their wooden furniture manufacturing business. She and her husband are honest, responsible and hardworking people.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for a new wooden furniture manufacturing business

loans.name: Amarjargal

texts.en: Mrs. Amarjargal is 37 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in the Sukhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Soronzonbold, is 35 years old and is an interior designer who works in a private construction company. Her daughter, Dolgoonmorongua, goes to kindergarten. She has been working as an assistant worker at a local market for years, and she also works part-time at the construction company her husband works at. She and her husband are planning on starting their own interior design business for local customers. She is asking for a 4,000,000 MNT loan to purchase starting inventory for her new interior design business. She and her husband are hardworking, honest, and responsible people.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for her new interior design business.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is a Peruvian artisan that specializes in tooled leather furniture and decor accents.  He would like to invest in the purchase of fine leather, wood and various fixtures to continue production.  Abel has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I have been crafting leather items since I was 16.  My older brother, Hector, taught me.  When I was 23, I opened my own workshop in my house.  I cut and tool fine leather with a distinct style and skill that you won't find in many workshops.  I design many beautiful Inca and colonial motifs, and emboss those upon the leather.  I am especially happy and proud that my products are being sold all over the world through the Internet."

"I would like to thank you for offering me your support through this microcredit.  It will allow me and my team to continue crafting items.  This is a traditional art form that has allowed us to provide our children with an education, and pass down a beautiful art."

Use the link below to view Abel's tooled leather furniture and decor accents on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/951

loans.use: to purchase fine leather, wood and various fixtures to continue production.

loans.name: Diego

texts.en:
Diego is an artisan in Guatemala who specializes in hand-carved wood art.  He would like to invest in the purchase of cedar, mahogany and granadillo woods, as well as in replacing some tools in his workshop.  Diego has been selling through NOVICA since 2011.  This is his story:

"What I enjoy the most about my work is also my biggest challenge, creating new designs.  Wood is a noble element, totally transformable, that gives you a lot if you know how to work it, treat it and take care of it.  I remember with much gratefulness a companion in the first workshop where I worked.  He took a lot of time to teach me things I never imagined possible to do with my hands.  Now I spend some of my time teaching the young people who work with me."

"I thank you for supporting our type of work and our art; without it, we wouldn’t be able to promote our work and provide properly for our families.  I appreciate your support by way of this microcredit so that we may get ahead in our work.  Being able to purchase the materials and tools we need means the artisans at the workshop can continue their work and we can develop our creativity.  May God bless you all!"

Use the link below to view Diego's hand-carved wood art on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8047

loans.use: to purchase cedar, mahogany and granadillo woods as well as to replace some tools in his workshop.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie, 47, is a widow and a mother of six children. Her children are all grown up and independent, and they are between the ages of 19 and 26. Julie lives in the Paynesville South community, called Kpelle town. For the past ten years, she has been selling pepper, vita, salt, onions, and rice at the community market. She loves to do this business because she feels self-reliant.  She received help from her sister to start in this  business. She will use the loan given to her to purchase more vita, salt, onions, and palm oil to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more vita, salt, onion, and palm oil to increase her sales

loans.name: Suwitra

texts.en:
Suwitra, from Bali, specializes in traditional batik and hand-painted apparel. He would like to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of fabric to expand production.

Suwitra has been selling through NOVICA since 2007. This is his story:

Suwitra designs and creates elegant wearable art through his unique ability to capture nature's beauty in clothing apparel. He masters batik and silk screening techniques as well as hand-painted motifs, which he transforms into colorful sarongs, scarves and stylish clothing.

"I am glad to have the possibility to receive this microcredit. I'll be able to buy the materials I need to build up my stock. Thanks to your support, I have an opportunity to develop my business. I hope this will also lead to more people that will really like my designs. Thank you so very much."

Use the link below to view Suwitra's batik and hand-painted apparel on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6227

loans.use: to purchase fabric in bulk.

loans.name: Jameo

texts.en: Jameo is a 40-year-old married woman who has been excited ever since she got to know about the UGAFODE micro-mortgage loan program. It is cost effective and affordable especially to the low income earners. She is convinced that with this program her dream of a decent house is going to be a reality and she and her children and grandchildren will be well accommodated, unlike in her current structure. She is dedicated to paying her loan installments on time and to building a good relationship with the institution.

loans.use: To complete her house

loans.name: Jarwolay

texts.en:
Jarwolay is 35 years old.  She is married and the mother of three children between the ages of three and 21 years.  She lives in a community called Peace Island in Jacob Town and all three of her children attend school.

She works very hard in her cook shop, or restaurant, where she sells food.  She works five days a week from 7 AM to 6 PM each day.  Jarwolay prepares cassava, potatoes, grains and palava sauce (a type of stew) to meet customer demand.  Because of the good service she provides to her customers, she makes a profit everyday.  With the profit, she buys more goods and attends to the needs of her children.  

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more ingredients for her business.  Her plan for the future is to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is an artisan who specializes in African masks and sculptures. He would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as wood, aluminum plates and paints.

Emmanuel has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"After completing a course in auto mechanics, getting a job was difficult and neither my parents nor I could afford the high cost of the machinery I would need to set up on my own. I struggled while doing odd jobs, but I managed to save what I could until I had enough money to buy a small piece of land and put up a wooden store, but I didn't know what to sell. I started buying finished carvings, and in the evenings I learned to carve these beautiful items. My background in auto mechanics became very useful at this point because of my knowledge in cutting and designing of metals, as well as the skill I learned from my father who was a blacksmith. With constant practice, I entered the world of art. My inspiration comes through dreams, so when I wake up I immediately put the design on paper in order not to lose the idea."

"This new microcredit will go a long way to help build up my stock and grow my business. Thank you so much for your help."

Use the link below to view Emmanuel's African masks and carvings on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1536

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as wood, aluminum plates and paints.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is an artisan who specializes in traditional West African masks. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials such as wood, metal plates and paints.

Evelyn has been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is her story:

"My greatest inspiration is to preserve our rich cultural heritage. Initially, I wasn't using a lot of different materials, but now I use recycled glass and glass beads, aluminum, brass and more. I sit and draw a mask creatively, and come up with the colors that will make it stand out."

"I believe that this microcredit will help me create a bigger stock of products and increase sales. My sincere gratitude to all of you for participating in the funding of this microcredit."

Use the link below to view Evelyn's African masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6750

loans.use: to purchase raw materials in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 40 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
De 47 años María es natural de Santa Rosa, decidió llevar una vida independiente únicamente al lado de sus 4 hijos, 2 de los cuales aún menores requieren todo su apoyo y atención. Es poseedora de una vivienda construida a base de madera en donde desempeña su rol de madre.
Es productora de productos agrícolas, dentro de los cuales esta su producto predilecto que es el cacao orgánico por ser un fruto de  mayor demanda en su región y de fácil crecimiento en la zona teniendo en cuenta todas las atenciones del caso.
Desarrolla sus actividades agrícolas en unas parcelas que adquirió con ayuda de su ex pareja desde hace 20 años pues para lograr obtener los frutos de calidad deseado debe contar con mano de obra adicional por parte de jornaleros del lugar para las distintas tareas complicadas.
Le agrada desempeñar sus actividades en el campo  debido a que le recuerda mucho a las épocas de niña que paso junto a sus padres realizando las mismas actividades , no obstante por el momento el cacao presenta cierta disminución en el precio final que ofrecen sus acopiadores , esperando mejore la situación para la próxima campaña.
Hallándose en el inicio de la campaña cuya cosecha esta proyectada para el próximo año necesita contar con capital para seguir expandiendo sus plantaciones y el respectivo reemplazo de árboles de cacao desfasados, para ello debe contar con plantas de almácigo así como abono orgánico proveniente del guano de isla, a ello es necesario añadirle el precio de la mano de obra  por parte de jornaleros cuyo pago se efectúa por adelantado. Ahora solicita 1,000 mil soles para comprar plantas de almácigo así como el de sacos de abono orgánico, con el dinero restante complementará su capital destinado para efectuar el pago a los jornaleros del lugar para desarrollar las tareas programadas.
texts.en:
At 47-years-old, Maria is a native of Santa Rosa. She decided to lead an independent life with only her four children by her side, two of whom are young and still require her support and attention. She is the owner of a wooden house where she performs her duties as a mother. 

Maria produces agricultural products, among which is her preferred product, organic cacao, because it is a fruit in high demand in her region and it is easily grown in the area considering everything required. She carries out her agricultural activities on parcels of land she acquired with the help of her ex-partner 20 years ago. In order to obtain the quality of fruits that she wants, she must rely on additional help from laborers on site to carry out distinct complicated tasks. 

She likes to work in the fields because it reminds her of times when she was a child together with her parents doing the same activities. However, by the time the cacao is ready there is a certain decrease in the final price offered by stockpilers. She is hoping to improve the situation for the next season.

Finding herself at the start of the season whose harvest is projected for next year, she needs to have capital in order to continue to expand her plantations and to replace old cacao trees respectively. For this reason she needs seedlings, and manure compost from Guano Island. It is also necessary to add the cost of manual labor, whose payment is made in advance. 

Now she is asking for 1000 soles to buy seedlings and bags of compost. The remaining money will be used to supplement the capital to pay the laborers to develop scheduled tasks.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and compost, and to hire workers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 20 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Ignacio Antonio

texts.en: Ignacio (pictured with his mother and wife), a dairy farmer, will use his 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to reduce costs and improve yields on his farm. He will process his cow waste to produce fuel for cooking and heating bathwater and for use as fertilizer for the cow feed: alfalfa and maize. This loan represents 43% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Benjamín

texts.en: Benjamín represents the future of farming in Mexico.  He is continuing the family tradition but wants to do so while reducing costs and decreasing the environmental impact caused by his animal waste.  Currently, the waste from his six cows is seen as just that - waste.  However, with his eight cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, this waste will generate fuel and fertilizer, allowing him to lower costs, maintain or improve yields, and reduce the odors and flies associated with manure piles. This loan represents 43% of the cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase an eight cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 25 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Marie Madeleine

texts.fr: Marie est une femme célibataire qui vit dans un qartier de la capital. Elle tient un restaurant depluis deux ans où elle propose divers plats. Grace à son dynamisme elle s'est faite une clientèle dont elle aimerait continuer de satisfaire. Pour cela, elle sollicite un prêt dans l'otique d'augmenter son stock de nourriture et de boissons. Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêt lui permettront d'assurer la pérennité de son entreprise tout en subvenant aux besoins de ses frères.
texts.en: Marie is a single woman who lives in a neighborhood in the capital. She has been running a restaurant for two years, where she serves diverse dishes. Due to her high energy, she has built a clientele she’d like to continue to satisfy. In order to do this, she is seeking a loan to increase her stock of food and beverages. The profits from this loan will allow her to ensure the longevity of her business while meeting the needs of her brothers.

loans.use: to increase her stock of food and beverages

loans.name: Lamentation  De Geremy Group

texts.fr:
Edma est la coordinatrice de son groupe Lamentation de Geremy. Elle habite dans la région de Trou-du-Nord d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle a dirigé son commerce de vente de charbon pendant les 4 dernières années. 

Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans le charbon, elle a acheté du bois pour le charbon. Des autres membres du groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre des produits alimentaires, cosmétiques, vêtements, chaussureset du charbon. Edma dit que son défi principal est en mesure de vendre plus depuis la crise économique en Haïti ne reçoit pas beaucoup d'argent.
texts.en:
Edma is the coordinator of her group, Lamentation de Geremy. She lives in the Trou-du-Nord region in Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. She has been running her charcoal-selling business for the last four years.

She would like to use this loan to invest in charcoal; she has bought wood for the charcoal. Some other members of the group need a loan for businesses such as selling food products, cosmetics, clothing, shoes, and charcoal. Edma says that her main challenge is to be able to sell more during the economic crisis in Haiti, where there isn’t a lot of money.

loans.use: to buy wood for charcoal

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor es una joven de 18 años que comparte una vida conyugal con Renán también de 18 años, ambos decidieron iniciarse desde jóvenes impulsados por el amor y la confianza única que hallaron entre si, como fruto de su relación tienen hoy a una preciosa niña de nombre Asulda de un año de edad para quien dirigen sus futuros objetivos. Temporalmente viven en una vivienda de adobe en calidad de alquiler.
Desde hace 2 años viene junto a Renán dedicándose a actividades agrícolas en unas parcelas que sus padres le brindaron por tratarse de una pareja joven y con muchos deseos de superación. Tienen como producto principal el cacao orgánico debido a ser un producto de mucha estabilidad en la zona, como todo inicio tuvieron ciertas dificultades al momento de lograr una estabilidad económica para el futuro familiar.
Lo alentador es que a pesar de iniciarse con poco capital han logrado cubrir con todos los gastos familiares básicos considerando que ya poseen una responsabilidad que es su pequeña, no obstante el trabajar en conjunto ha sido una gran herramienta de unión pues la comprensión y la armonía familiar priman en su entorno familiar.
Hace poco recibió una propuesta por parte de una comerciante del lugar quien le ofreció su tienda en calidad de alquiler por un buen tiempo ya que planea retirarse de viaje por diversos motivos, considerando una buena oportunidad planea tomarla y así paralelo al campo con su pareja a cargo espera aportar a la economía familiar.
Tiene muchos deseos a futuro dentro de los cuales está el de seguir estudios superiores en la carrera de farmacia ya que se siente en la capacidad de cumplirla en un tiempo no muy lejano. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, se siente muy agradecida por la oportunidad brindada que ya considera es el motor que necesita actualmente para cumplir sus objetivos comerciales con mayor fluidez. Agradece a sus compañeros de su  banco comunal por la gran oportunidad que le brindan y por la acogida comprometiéndose a cumplir con todos los acuerdos estipulados.
Con los 500 nuevos soles complementará su capital que tiene destinado para el pago del primer mes del alquiler de una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que manejará en adelante.
texts.en:
Flor, 18, shares her married life with Renán, also 18.  They decided to start together from a young age, driven by love and the special trust between them.  As a fruit of their relationship they have a precious little girl named Asulda, age 1, to whom they direct their future goals.  They live temporarily in an adobe house, which they rent.

For two years she has made a living with Renán in agricultural work on some plots of land her parents gave her because they're a young couple with a great desire to improve themselves.  Their main crop is organic cacao because it's very stable in the area.  As in any beginning they had certain problems trying to achieve financial stability for the future family.

What's encouraging is that, in spite of starting out with little capital, they've managed to cover all the basic family expenses, considering that they already have the responsibility of their little girl.  Nevertheless, working together has been a great tool for unity because understanding and family harmony prevail in their family environment.

A little while ago she received a proposal from a merchant in the area who offered to rent her his store for a long time because he plans to take a trip for a variety of reasons.  She considers it a good opportunity and plans to take it.  So she hopes to contribute to the family finances along with the field work with her husband in charge.

She has many desires for the future, including studying pharmacy at the advanced level because she feels she's capable of doing that in the near future.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She's very grateful for this opportunity, which she considers the motivation she needs right now to realize her commercial objectives more fluidly.  She's grateful to her colleagues in her communal bank for the great opportunity they're giving her and for their welcome, and she's committing herself to complying with all the stipulated agreements.

With the 500 nuevos soles [PEN] she'll supplement the capital she has dedicated to paying the first month's rent on a small grocery store that she'll manage from now on.

loans.use: to rent a store to sell products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and stock canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Née vers 1975 à Sikasso, Madame Mariam est veuve et mère de 3 enfants qui réside chez son feu époux avec ses enfants, dans une famille nucléaire à Wayerma dans la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Mariam, après plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initiée depuis plus de dix années à cette activité de petit commerce notamment à l’achat vente de vêtements, de sacs à main,  de tissus brodés, de pagnes, etc.). Elle achète ses marchandises à Bobo Dioulasso ( Burkina Faso) avant de les revendre à sa place au grand marché de Sikasso où ses marchandises sont beaucoup sollicitées de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement des des femmes de ménages et vendeuses de du marché) pour leur qualité.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décide d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui elle est à son premier prêt. Ainsi, elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter, 30 pièces de pagne wax, 20 complets de tissus brodé et 20 sacs à main. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1975 in Sikasso, Ms. Mariam is a widow and the mother of three children. She resides in her deceased husband's home with her children in a nuclear family located in Wayerma, in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After several unsuccessful businesses, Ms. Mariam was introduced to small-scale commerce over ten years ago and particularly in the buying and selling of clothing, handbags, embroidered cloth, 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), etc.  She purchases her merchandise in Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso) and then resells it from her spot at the big market of Sikasso where her merchandise is much in demand by her customers (composed essentially of housekeepers retailers at the market) for its quality. 

Concerned about further satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her first loan. Thus, she is requesting this loan to increase her business capital for buying: 30 lengths of Wax 'pagne' cloth, 20 sets of embroidered fabrics, and 20 handbags. 

She envisions making a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used to help cover family expenses and pay the loan interest. And the rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Assata

texts.fr:
Madame Assata  est née vers 1977 à Sikasso, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit avec son époux dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Sanoubougou II, le centre ville de Sikasso. 
Madame Assata est enseignante de formation, à défaut de pratiquer cette profession elle s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et vente des  laits frais, laits cailles et yaourts depuis 10 années. Elle mène son activité dans un kiosque situé dans son quartier de Sikasso et de façon ambulante. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ une année. Elle est à son premier prêt.
 Elle sollicite ce premier prêt individuel dans le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter 100 litres de lait frais pour en transformer en lait caillés et en yaourt afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Assata was born around 1977 in Sikasso. She is married and the mother of five children. She lives with her husband in a large traditional extended family in Sanoubougou II, the downtown of Sikasso City. Ms. Assata is a teacher by training. Instead of practicing this profession, she became familiar with the buying and selling of fresh milk, curdled milk, and yoghurt ten years ago. She operates in a kiosk located in her district in Sikasso and by going door to door. 

Concerned about further satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso about a year ago. She in on her first loan. She is requesting this individual loan with the goal of increasing her business capital, so as to purchase 100 liters of fresh milk for processing into curds and yoghurt. This is to do better in satisfying her burgeoning customer base.

With this loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA that will be used to help cover family expenses and pay the loan interest. And the rest will invested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh milk

loans.name: Maminata

texts.fr:
Née vers 1969 à Sikasso, Madame Maminata est mariée et mère de quatre enfants, elle vit chez son époux avec ses enfants dans une famille nucléaire à Lafiabougou, dans la ville de Sikasso.
Madame Maminata après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initiée depuis plus de cinq ans à cette activité génératrices de revenus. Elle jouit d’une grande réputation dans son lieu d’achat et vente des condiments à la maison et au marché de Lafiabougou dont elle dispose une place.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cessait d’accroitre, elle décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 5 seaux de pâtes d’arachide, 3 cartons magie, 2 cartons concentrée tomate,  3 sacs d’oignons et 5 cartons de moutarde) à Sikasso 
Madame Maminata vend  au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de tous les couches sociales. 
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utiliser pour réaliser pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1969 in Sikasso, Ms. Maminata is marred and the mother of four children. She lives at her husband's place with her children in a nuclear family located in Wayerma, in Sikasso City. After several unsuccessful businesses, Ms. Maminata was introduced to this revenue-generating business over five years ago. She enjoys a great reputation locally buying and selling condiments at the house and at the Lafiabougou market, where she has a spot. 

Concerned about further satisfying her ever-growing customer base, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her first individual loan. This loan will be used to purchase: 5 pails of peanut butter, 3 boxes of Magie [bouillon cubes], 2 boxes of tomato paste, 2 sacks of onions, and 5 boxes of mustard, in Sikasso. 

Accepting cash or credit, Ms. Maminata makes her sales to customers from all walks of life. With this loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used to help cover family expenses and pay the loan interest. And the rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Née vers 1963 à N’Kourala préfecture de Sikasso, Madame Mariam est veuve et mère de quatre enfants qui réside à Médine-Sikasso. 
Madame Mariam après avoir perdu son époux, s’est initiée au domaine du commerce notamment à l’achat vente de condiments. Elle vend au nouveau de marché de Médine où elle dispose d’un magasin et où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ deux années. Ainsi elle a bénéficié trois crédits qui ont été tous remboursés avec succès. Alors dans but de toujours mieux se relancer dans même activité, elle sollicite ce quatrième crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour pouvoir acheter, 15 sacs de tomates fraîches, 15 sacs d’oignons de graines différentes et de stock de condiments.
Ses marchandises sont achetées sur place avec les paysans venus des villages environnants et  ramenées pour vente dans les marchés hebdomadaires de Yorosso et Kouri vers la frontière Mali-Burkina Faso, en détail et en gros au comptant les jours de foire à une clientèle composée essentiellement de forains.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 110 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Born around 1963 in the N’Kourala prefecture of Sikasso, Mrs. Mariam is a widowed mother of four children who lives in Médine-Sikasso. After having lost her husband, Mrs. Mariam started selling food condiments. She sells at the Médine market, where she has a store, and where she is heavily sought after by her clientele for the quality of her products. In order to satisfy her growing clientele, she decided to join microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso about two years ago. She has already benefited from three loans, which have all been successfully repaid. In the goal of continuing to improve her business, she is seeking a fourth loan, which will allow her to increase her business funds to be able to buy 15 sacks of fresh tomatoes, 15 sacks of onions, different grains, and a stock of condiments. Her products are bought on the spot by farmers coming from neighboring villages and brought back to sell in the weekly markets in Yorosso and Kouri near the Mali-Burkina Faso border, for retail and wholesale for credit on fair days to a clientele composed essentially of fairground people. She envisions earning with this loan a monthly profit of 110,000 FCFA, which will be used to contribute to family expenses, pay interest on her loan, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy food condiments

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of beverages to resell.
